title.english: Yosuga no Sora: In Solitude Where We are Least Alone

description:
Haruka Kasugano and his twin sister Sora have lost both their parents in an accident, and with them all their support. They decide to move out of the city to the rural town where they once spent summers with their late grandfather. At first everything seems familiar and peaceful, but changes come as Haruka starts to remember things from his youth.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Anthology
tags.description: A collection of separate works collated into a single release.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Mahjong
tags.description: Centered around the game of mahjong.

tags.name: Netorare
tags.description: Netorare is what happens when the protagonist gets their partner stolen from them by someone else. It is a sexual fetish designed to cause sexual jealousy by way of having the partner indulge in sexual activity with someone other than the protagonist.

tags.name: Masturbation
tags.description: Features erotic stimulation of one's own genitalia or other erogenous regions.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

node.description:
[Website](http://www.eufonius.net/)

Japanese progressive rock music group which debuted on October 11, 2003.

__Members:__
[Hajime Kikuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/104846/Hajime-Kikuchi) (菊地創) - composition and arrangement
[riya](https://anilist.co/staff/267603) (りや) - vocals and lyrics
Susumu Ookubo (大久保将) - Supporting member
Originally an animator. Often works with [Hijiri Sanpei](https://anilist.co/staff/149565/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nocturamayama)

Yamashita graduated from Kokugakuin University with a Major in History. He first started out in the industry in 1997 as a production assistant at JCF. Amazingly, he has never been formally trained in art. His talent for drawing was first discovered through various doodles and sketches he would make on company paperwork.

Yamashita's first project as an animator was on [the second Kochikame movie](https://anilist.co/anime/3547/). Some time later he went freelance. [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/) was the first project he worked on freelance. Around 2006, Yamashita joined [Bee Train](https://anilist.co/studio/5/) and started work as character designer and animation director on the TV show [Ginyuu Mokushiroku Meine Liebe Wieder](https://anilist.co/anime/771/). A short while later, the animation department at Bee Train was spun off into new company, [C-Station](https://anilist.co/studio/6074/), and Yamashita moved with it. Today he retains a seat at C-Station, but regularly contracts out to work on various external projects.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/荒川稔久)

Married to fellow scriptwriter [Hiroko Naka](https://anilist.co/staff/181820/).

__Residency:__ Chiba Prefecture, Japan

__Manabu Miwa__, better known as Manack, is a Japanese composer and arranger known for his composition and arrangement in popular visual novels such as Yosuga no Sora, Little Busters!, Kud Wafter and most recently, Rewrite.

__[Website](https://manabumiwa.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ManabuMiwa)__

[Official Website](https://www.momoclo.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/momoclo_king_pr) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6YNWTm6zuMFsjqd0PO3G-Q)

Momoiro Clover Z (abbreviated Momoclo) is a four member idol girl group represented by Stardust Promotion under Section 3's 3Bjunior. The group was formed in 2008, originally under the name Momoiro Clover. The group gradually garnered popularity and fanbase following their single debut in 2009 and major debut in 2010.

They are known for their energetic and acrobatic performances, color-coded system and unconventional concepts. 

Their sister group is [Shiritsu Ebisu Chuugaku](https://anilist.co/staff/149421/Shiritsu-Ebisu-Chuugaku).

Team.Nekokan [Neko] (Team.ねこかん[猫]), literally "canned cat," is a independent J-rock band known for their video game-themed tracks. The "[猫]" in their name represents their namesake; the brackets being an "E-can," or energy can, borrowed from the video game series Rockman (known as Megaman internationally), while the symbol 猫 (neko) means "cat".  Members: nyanyannya (or ねこ) - Vocals Sham (シャム) - Guitar

title.native: 俺の妹がこんなに可愛いわけがない
